intro: Microdesmis magallanensis, commonly known as the Magallanes microdesmis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
